body:
You can find that class here:

https://github.com/ota4j-team/opentest4j/blob/b6305430b88f3036c71fcf3a20522bfc9c7bd498/src/main/java/org/opentest4j/AssertionFailedError.java

This is one of the few dependencies allowed by the JUnit 5 team.

Thank you, I know that: I've done my research before asking. But this specific piece of information is missing from the documentation itself. My request is that the documentation provides a link to the documentation of the class, or at the very least provide the full name of the class (rather than the simple name). I want to be able to identify the class from the Javadoc. It's currently not possible.

issue.title: Updates references to AssertionFailedError to use its FQCN.

milestone.title: 5.0 M3
milestone.description: Themes: JUnit 4 interoperability, additional discovery selectors.

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ‚úÖ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Since javadocs are produced and published to Maven Central for both the JUnit 5 and OpenTest4J projects, Eclipse and other IDES don't have a problem linking imported Javadocs between the projects.  The JUnit 5 javadocs published at http://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/api/ cannot however resolve these links, so providing the FQCN provides readers with additional information to locate the related javadocs.

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the JUnit Contributor License Agreement.

Resolves #560.

body: See PR #561 ... the "simple name" has been replaced by the FQCN for AssertionFailedError in the TOC javadoc.  Note that this still won't result in a link in the on-line JUnit 5 javadocs at http://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/api/.
Good catch! I think we should publish the Javadocs for opentest4j separately and then configure the Gradle Javadoc task to generate links to it.

> I think we should publish the Javadocs for opentest4j separately and then configure the Gradle Javadoc task to generate links to it. 

I agree. üëç
This issue is blocked by ota4j-team/opentest4j#28.
The latest snapshot Javadocs now link to Javadoc of OpenTest4J as well as the JDK APIs: http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/.
Wow, that was fast! Thank you very much! :-)
